definition[0]: used when you are adding a fact or piece of information that seems surprising, or seems very different from what you have just said
example[0]: This is a cheap and simple process. However, there are dangers.
example[1]: an extremely unpleasant disease that is, however, easy to treat
definition[1]: used to say that it does not matter how big, good, serious etc something is because it will not change a situation in any way
example[2]: You should report any incident, however minor it is.
example[3]: We have to finish, however long it takes.
example[4]: I really want the car, however much it costs.
definition[2]: used to show surprise when you ask how something happens or how someone does something
example[5]: However did he get that job?
example[6]: You can do it however you like.
example[7]: If we win the match, weâ€™ll be delighted, however it happens.
example[8]: However you look at it, it was a wicked thing to do.
